title: Teapot And Cover, "Cornucopia", 1920–30
markings: Marks: On underside of body: Imperial Porcelain Factory mark for Nicholas II with 1901
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Body with flaring sides, slightly squared off, long curved spout, high loop handle, lid with vine form handle; painted on one side with stylized cornucopia and flower blossoms and on the other in black and gilding; gilded rim around top edge and base of body, around outer edge and handle of lid

tombstone.epitaph:
Teapot And Cover, "Cornucopia", 1920–30.
1920–30. porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-64-a,b.
